qas.question: Who are the most well-known wrestling bears?

answers.text: Ginger, Victor, Hercules and Terrible Ted

qas.question: What animal has been a part of wrestling for a long time?
What condition are bears usually brought in in?
How many states have banned bear wrestling as of 2006?

context: Though they have not had the level of exposure as other wrestlers, <a1_0>bears<a1_0/> have long been a part of professional wrestling. Usually <a2_0>declawed and muzzled<a2_0/>, they often wrestled shoot matches against <a3_0>audience members<a3_0/>, offered a cash reward if they could pin the bear. They also wrestled professionals in worked, often battle royal or handicap, matches (usually booked so the bear won). Though they have wrestled around the world and continue to do so, wrestling bears enjoyed their greatest popularity in the Southern United States, during the 1960s and 1970s. The practice of bear wrestling has met strong opposition from animal rights activists in recent decades, contributing to its lack of mainstream acceptance. As of 2006, it is banned in <a4_0>20<a4_0/> U.S. states. Perhaps the most famous wrestling bears are <a0_0>Ginger, Victor, Hercules and Terrible Ted<a0_0/>.
